column22: Overlay rules for development dimensions/other rules are detailed on Page 2-41 of the Berlin Land Use and Development Regulations (zoning code). There are new height limitations, but only that structures should not be so tall as to interfere with air traffic.

column22: Water/wastewater connections are required for subdivisions located within the public water service area, but this ruling is not specified for structures in general. If a lot is located within the public water service area it is probable that a connection to water and/or wastewater is required. Conditional use review required for multi-family developments with 16+ units. "Accessory dwellings [...] are allowed only as an accessory use to a pre-existing dwelling" (Page 2-23). As such, ADUs are marked as prohibited for new developments.
column170: Parking Spaces Add'l to Main Unit

column22: New residential developments of any kind are not permitted within the floodway. Outside the floodway multi-family housing and large accessory structures (>500sqft) is permitted conditionally (with public hearing) in districts other than the following: Rural 40, Rural 218, Upland Conservation, and Shoreland Conservation. Small accessory structures (=<500sqft) are permitted everywhere outside the floodway.

column21:
DWELLING, MULTI-FAMILY. A structure or part of a structure containing three or more
dwelling units each intended for habitation by one household and providing complete
independent living facilities including permanent provisions for living, sleeping, eating,
cooking and sanitation.

Major Projects. The Development Review Board will review site plan applications for major
projects as follows:
(1) The Development Review Board must hold a public hearing and issue a decision on a
site plan application in accordance with Section 4601 and Section 4605.
